body_html:
Thanks for the help. Yeah, I know I could filter out messages like this, that's what I meant by playing stderr games. But it's a pain.

The environment variable trick works. I'd suggest plugging that directly into tf.logging(), or at least documenting it somewhere, to be user-friendly. I did a search prior to reporting the problem. At least this bug will get indexed so it might help other people.

For posterity, add this to your programs to shut up the initial warnings:
os.environ["TF_CPP_MIN_LOG_LEVEL"]="2"

Thanks again.

body:
Thanks for the help. Yeah, I know I could filter out messages like this, that's what I meant by playing stderr games. But it's a pain.

The environment variable trick works. I'd suggest plugging that directly into tf.logging(), or at least documenting it somewhere, to be user-friendly. I did a search prior to reporting the problem. At least this bug will get indexed so it might help other people.

For posterity, add this to your programs to shut up the initial warnings:
os.environ["TF_CPP_MIN_LOG_LEVEL"]="2"

Thanks again.
